content:
@all ESDS is hosting a (Re)Introduction to Earth System Data Science (ESDS) Across NCAR/UCAR/UCP on November 10th and 11th (Thursday-Friday). This event will be hybrid, in-person in NCARâ€™s Mesa Lab Main Seminar Room and virtual over Zoom or Google Meet.

Please register to the event through the Registration Form by Friday, November 4, 2022!

More details on the ESDS website: https://ncar.github.io/esds/posts/2022/esds-fall-event/
@all , if you are planning to attend the event in-person, it is best to register sooner rather than later as the main seminar room attendance will be limited.
A quick reminder that registration for the ESDS Fall Event closes tomorrow, Friday Nov 4!

@all If you're attending the ESDS event this week be sure to check out the blog post detailing materials and instructions to prepare for the event: https://ncar.github.io/esds/posts/2022/esds-event-prep/
Feel free to post any questions on this stream.
Where are the links to the google breakout rooms?

@Thomas Martin The agenda is here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/10cgElI2Rl8gCqH3oSQqEXzmW-3sSbrv9LQ9eM6A7v8g/edit?usp=sharing
And the google meet links are here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1yfVtLzVoez3ptTntuWFBTjvBxXuatGlurfgAj5wzz-M/edit?usp=sharing

Thanks to everyone who participated today.

Tomorrow we'll be starting at 11am, later than planned to accommodate those attending the town hall in person (see updated agenda)

  • We will begin with an open forum discussion on the ESDS initiative to gather input on community needs and preferences for the upcoming year.
  • Following that we will have an open-ended hackathon/discussion group session for the rest of the day.
    • Please submit your ideas for a hackathon group, or browse existing proposals here

Looking forward to seeing everyone tomorrow!
This is going on now for day 2!
